channel.title: Red tint on gameboy game
channel.description: I recently got pokemon red along with a bunch of other games off of craigslist. When I put the cartridge into my gameboy advance and play, the game has an odd red tint over pretty much everything. Squirtle is red, grass is red, and the players hat is green. I had it right once but as soon as i restarted the game it was once again tinted. Is there anything I can do? Is this a common problem?

item.title: Red tint on gameboy game
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:15, topic:386687”][quote author=thepinksock link=topic=482451.msg3534403#msg3534403 date=1300457247]

Blowing on the contacts is actually bad for the games.
You’re better off with a q-tip and some glass cleaner.

How can blowing on some metal connectors be bad for it?
[/quote]

something to do with saliva and oxidation messing up the contacts in the long run idunno[/quote]
Exactly. The q-tip method works fine.

Read full topic

Blowing on the contacts is actually bad for the games.
You’re better off with a q-tip and some glass cleaner.

[quote=“sppt, post:13, topic:386687”]Blowing on the contacts is actually bad for the games.

item.title: Red tint on gameboy game
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Rix_:

I usually solve the problem by blowing into both the cartridge’s and Gameboy’s rectangular hole. Does the red tint only happen on the Pokemon game?

Blowing on the contacts is actually bad for the games.
You’re better off with a q-tip and some glass cleaner.

Read full topic

item.title: Red tint on gameboy game
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Teh Spede:

LOOOOOOOOL It’s meant to have a red tint.

LOOOOOOOL.

Read full topic

item.title: Red tint on gameboy game
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

cumescape:

Oh wow… You really didn’t know they are supposed to have the tint? Its the same with Blue and Yellow (and I am sure Green)

I never got to play pokemon when I was a kid, my friends recently started playing again so I first played it a day or two ago.

Read full topic

item.title: Red tint on gameboy game
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

Oh wow… You really didn’t know they are supposed to have the tint? Its the same with Blue and Yellow (and I am sure Green)

Read full topic

item.title: Red tint on gameboy game
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:8, topic:386687”][quote author=Rix_ link=topic=482451.msg3533267#msg3533267 date=1300358165]

LOOOOOOOOL It’s meant to have a red tint.

But I looked at some YouTube videos of people playing Pokemon Red and the maps aren’t tinted with red at all.




[/quote]

pc emus are usually black and white with a custom tint changer

my blue cartridge typically has blueish terrain and a red character, however if you use gameboy classic games on a gba or gba sp in my case, pressing the directional buttons when first turning the device on while it shows the gameboy logo you can change the global colour pallet or something along those lines, I can get red, green, dark purple and default blue on my sp[/quote]
Oh, that’s it! Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Red tint on gameboy game
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Rix_, post:7, topic:386687”][quote author=Teh Spede link=topic=482451.msg3533251#msg3533251 date=1300353882]
LOOOOOOOOL It’s meant to have a red tint.
[/quote]
But I looked at some YouTube videos of people playing Pokemon Red and the maps aren’t tinted with red at all.



pc emus are usually black and white with a custom tint changer

my blue cartridge typically has blueish terrain and a red character, however if you use gameboy classic games on a gba or gba sp in my case, pressing the directional buttons when first turning the device on while it shows the gameboy logo you can change the global colour pallet or something along those lines, I can get red, green, dark purple and default blue on my sp

Read full topic

item.title: Red tint on gameboy game
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Teh Spede:

LOOOOOOOOL It’s meant to have a red tint.

But I looked at some YouTube videos of people playing Pokemon Red and the maps aren’t tinted with red at all.

item.title: Red tint on gameboy game
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Rix_:

I usually solve the problem by blowing into both the cartridge’s and Gameboy’s rectangular hole. Does the red tint only happen on the Pokemon game?

I tried that as well remembering how it worked on the NES, but unfortunately to no avail. I tried blue and found out it has a similar thing but blue so I guess maybe it’s just part of the game. I’m confused as to why the colors were different that one time, though… maybe it was my imagination. Thanks anyways though!

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Yeah, it plugs into the advance though. I thought maybe it was just part of the game however I got the regular colors (green grass, red trainer) once so I’m guessing it’s not.

Read full topic
